<<<<<<< HEAD
The case of Sir Thomas Pilkington, Kt. (now Lord Mayor of London) Sir Thomas Player, Kt. deceased; Slingisby Bethell, Esq; Henry Cornish, Esq; deceas'd; Samuel Shute, Esq; deceas'd; Samuel Swynock, John Deagle, Francis Jenkes, deceas'd; Richard Freeman, John Jekyll, Robert Kaye and John Wickam, all now, or late citizens of London; as to the riot pretended to be committed by them in the election of sheriffs in the year 1682 Pilkington, Thomas, Sir, d. 1691. England and Wales. Court of King's Bench.
8 p.
[s.n.], [London : printed in the year, 1689.]
Caption title. Imprint from colophon. Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library.
=======
